Total_Links:
Oberoi Realty launched Elysian Tower D at Oberoi Garden City, Goregaon on April 30, 2025.

The launch garnered a strong positive response with bookings worth approximately ₹970 crore for ~2.1 lakh sq. ft. of RERA carpet area within the first few days.

Elysian Tower D features 3 and 4-BHK residences and is part of the larger 80-acre Oberoi Garden City development.

The company announced its Q4 FY25 and full-year FY25 financial results onApril 28, 2025.

Oberoi Realty recorded its highest-ever annual consolidated revenue of ₹5,286 crores and the highest-ever annual booking value of over ₹5,281 crores.

However, Q4 FY25 saw a 45% YoY decline in net profit to ₹433.2 crore, primarily attributed to a 207% YoY increase in land acquisition costs which reached ₹587 crore.

Revenue from operations for Q4 FY25 dipped 12.5% YoY to ₹1,150 crore.

FY25 revenue rose 17.6% YoY to ₹5,286.3 crore and profit grew by 15.5% YoY to ₹2,225.51 crore.

The Board of Directors declared afourth interim dividend of ₹2 per equity sharefor FY25 onApril 28, 2025.

The record date for determining eligible shareholders was set asMay 5, 2025.

The dividend payout was scheduled to begin fromMay 26, 2025.

The Board approved the incorporation of a wholly-owned subsidiary intended to be thecorporate social responsibility (CSR) armof the Oberoi Group.

In December 2024, Oberoi Realty signed a development agreement for land in Alibaug for a luxury hotel/resort and high-end villas.

The company was appointed as the developer for a slum rehabilitation project at Bandra Reclamation, Mumbai on January 10, 2025.

Oberoi Realty hosted an earnings call onApril 29, 2025, to discuss its Q4 FY25 financial results and key business updates.

Oberoi Realty's stock price closed at ₹1,655.65 on April 28, 2025, after the announcement of Q4 results and dividend, compared to ₹1,610.20 at the previous close.

However, on a year-to-date (YTD) basis, the stock had lost 27.34% in 2025 as of April 28, 2025.

The stock had touched its 52-week low of ₹1,440.05 on April 7, 2025, and a 52-week high of ₹2,349.80 on December 27, 2024.
